issues.description: The `messageOnRide` method signature is inconsistent: the problem statement’s UML and template usage expect a parameterless method `messageOnRide(): String`, but the solution’s `Rideable` interface and its implementations define `messageOnRide(String equipment)`.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the specification by changing the `Rideable` interface and its implementations to declare `String messageOnRide()` (no parameters), or update the problem statement and template to require `messageOnRide(String equipment)` consistently.

issues.description: The `messageOnRide` method signature in the solution (and its implementations) includes a `String equipment` parameter, whereas the problem statement and template define `messageOnRide()` with no parameters returning “Riding on [Animal Type] [name]”. This mismatch prevents students from mapping the required call `r.messageOnRide()` in the template and as described in the problem to the solution’s implementation.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the `Rideable` interface and its implementations with the problem statement by removing the equipment parameter so that `messageOnRide()` takes no arguments and returns “Riding on [Animal Type] [name]”.
